Signs your dog is getting enough water:
‚Ä¢ Normal drinking: You see them drink regularly throughout the day (around 1 oz per pound of body weight is a general guide).
‚Ä¢ Moist gums: Pink and slippery to the touch.
‚Ä¢ Quick skin tent: Skin on their back snaps back quickly when gently pinched and released.
‚Ä¢ Bright eyes: Not sunken or dull.
‚Ä¢ Normal energy: Not lethargic or weak.
‚Ä¢ Light yellow urine: Not dark or strong-smelling.

If you're concerned, monitor their water bowl and watch for these signs. If you see signs of dehydration (dry gums, slow skin tent, lethargy), offer water and consult your vet if it doesn‚Äôt improve.
